cluster_relations.rel_desc: Different butterfly species influence the size, shape, and color characteristics of eggs in the egg stage.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject species causally affects a specific life-history trait or characteristic of the object life stage or process (e.g., morphology, timing, or duration).

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: egg size, shape, and color vary with species
qualifiers.OtherQualifier: AffectedTraits: egg size, egg shape, egg color

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The butterfly species influences how long the metamorphosis process lasts.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject species causally affects a specific life-history trait or characteristic of the object life stage or process (e.g., morphology, timing, or duration).

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: anywhere from a few days to several weeks

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The duration of the adult butterfly lifespan depends on the butterfly species.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the value or magnitude of the subject life-history trait is causally dependent on which butterfly species is involved.

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: lifespan ranges from a few days to a few weeks

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject butterfly species causally affects a specific life-history trait or characteristic of the object life stage or process (e.g., morphology, timing, or duration).
args.justification: The first two relations both express that the butterfly species (subject) causally affects a life-history trait (egg traits or metamorphosis duration). Renaming the canonical predicate to 'species_influences_life_history_trait' makes the subject role explicit and aligns the two instances under a single, clearer predicate while remaining within the same dependency class and CAUSALITY group. The third relation legitimately uses a complementary direction (trait depends on species) and should keep its distinct canonical name.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject butterfly species causally affects a specific life-history trait or characteristic of the object life stage or process (e.g., morphology, timing, or duration).
executed_decisions.justification: The first two relations both express that the butterfly species (subject) causally affects a life-history trait (egg traits or metamorphosis duration). Renaming the canonical predicate to 'species_influences_life_history_trait' makes the subject role explicit and aligns the two instances under a single, clearer predicate while remaining within the same dependency class and CAUSALITY group. The third relation legitimately uses a complementary direction (trait depends on species) and should keep its distinct canonical name.
